title: Home
text:
Hi, I’m Dhwani Modi
I recently graduated with an M.A. in Industrial & Organizational Psychology from NYU, and I specialize in turning survey data into actionable organizational insights. I have hands-on experience with:

Survey design
Data analysis
Machine learning
Applied negotiation & conflict resolution
Management Consulting

Below you’ll find my Resume and Projects. Feel free to Contact me if you’d like to chat.

title: Resume
text:
New York, New York 10025 | (646) 656-2102 | modidhwani21@gmail.com | linkedin.com/in/dhwanimodi21



New York University, New York, NY
Master of Arts in Industrial and Organizational Psychology
September 2023 – May 2025
GPA: 3.87
Relevant coursework: Organization Development, Employee Training, Leadership and Strategic Change, Management Consulting, Performance Measurement & Rewards, Machine Learning, Conflict and Negotiation, Databases for Business Analytics.
Pandit Deendayal Energy University, Gandhinagar, Gujarat, India
Bachelor of Arts (Honors) in Psychology
July 2019 – May 2023






March 2025 – April 2025
- Built and evaluated classification models (Random Forest, Decision Trees, Logistic Regression, Naïve Bayes Classification) to predict trust levels in neighborhoods using demographic and perception survey data.
- Achieved 75.6% model accuracy; evaluated performance using confusion matrices, precision/recall, and kappa statistics.
- Conducted feature‐importance analysis to interpret key predictors, including income level, civic participation, and neighborhood safety.



September 2024 – December 2024
- Analyzed a tech company’s performance management system, including appraisal tools, evaluation criteria, and 360-degree feedback.
- Assessed links between performance ratings and outcomes like pay, development, and promotion.
- Proposed improvements using Behaviorally Anchored Rating Scales (BARS) and best practices to enhance fairness and consistency.
- Recommended manager training using the 70-20-10 model and delivered findings in a team presentation.



October 2024
- Served as the leadership expert on a cross‐functional team in a university-level consulting competition.
- Analyzed a human resource management problem for a client, applying change-management frameworks to assess workplace challenges and suggest actionable solutions.
- Collaborated to identify key issues and develop a comprehensive strategy based on qualitative and quantitative analysis.
- Presented findings to a panel of industry experts, integrating both data‐driven insights and practical recommendations.



January 2024 – May 2024
- Conducted a comprehensive needs assessment for training programs, identifying KSAOs required by physicians and medical staff to leverage AI in diagnostics and patient care.
- Developed customized training environments, incorporating AI fundamentals and ethical/legal guidelines tailored for healthcare.
- Created innovative learning methods (VR simulations, live webinars, e-learning platforms) to ensure effective knowledge transfer.
- Established a structured evaluation plan to measure training success via direct observation, feedback loops, and on-the-job assessments.







January 2024 – May 2024
- Designed the research study and created a questionnaire targeting variables related to professional development and remote work.
- Performed statistical analysis (Descriptive Statistics, Individual t-tests, ANOVA, Correlation, Regression) in R to examine relationships between variables.
- Presented findings and recommendations to improve training and mentoring initiatives aimed at enhancing employee satisfaction and retention.



January 2023 – May 2023
- Designed the research study and crafted a questionnaire measuring work-life balance, job satisfaction, and turnover intentions.
- Conducted statistical analysis (Descriptive Statistics, ANOVA, Correlation, Regression) in Excel to evaluate the relationship between work-life balance factors and employee retention.
- Presented findings and recommendations to the dissertation panel, emphasizing practical implications for organizational policy and employee well-being.






Statistical & Data Tools: R, SQL, Microsoft Office, Qualtrics

Machine Learning: Naïve Bayes, Decision Trees, Random Forest, Logistic Regression

Data Visualization & Analysis: Data Collection, Statistical Analysis, Business Presentation, Data Visualization
I/O Psychology: Survey Design, Needs Assessment, Training & Development, Performance Measurement, Consulting

text:
